snippet: An increase in violence at the New York City jail complex has alarmed officials and inmate advocates; correction officers struggle particularly with mentally ill inmates.
abstract: Surge of violence and disorder at New York City's Rikers Island jail complex has alarmed oversight officials, union leaders and inmate advocates; over past decade, use of force by correction officers has jumped nearly 240 percent, even as daily population has declined by almost 15 percent over same period; at heart of rising violence is an inmate population that has changed significantly, and in many ways grown more volatile.
lead_paragraph: An increase in violence at the New York City jail complex has alarmed officials and inmate advocates; correction officers struggle particularly with mentally ill inmates.

headline.main: Rikers Island Struggles With a Surge in Violence and Mental Illness
headline.print_headline: Rikers Island Struggles With a Rise in Violence
